Context:
Program Name: Marketing Management – Digital Media
Code: B433
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 12 months (2 semesters in-class, 1 semester work experience)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,492.00 *
International Tuition: $18,428.00 **
Centre: Business
School: Marketing
Location: St. James Campus
Program Type: Digital Media (contains elements of social media marketing, mobile marketing, search marketing, content marketing, owned media marketing, paid media marketing, and marketing analytics)
Duration Semesters: 2 in-class semesters, 1 semester work experience
Semesters Availability: Fall 2024, Winter 2025, Spring 2025 (Open for domestic students and international students, except Spring 2025 for international students which opens on Aug 6, 2024)
Experiential Learning: Work Experience (Co-op or Internship) Required

* Domestic tuition fee for the year indicated in the text.
** International tuition fee for the year indicated in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Postgraduate) B433 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The Marketing Management - Digital Media program offers students skills in digital communication and media for marketing plans, conducting market research, evaluating marketing products or services, delivering persuasive messages through various media, and preparing sales pitches or presentations. Students will take both in-class and hybrid courses, requiring access to a computer. The program is offered in an online format with specific application requirements (B423) for international students. The minimum computing requirements include PC or Apple/Mac systems with certain processors, RAM, web cameras, microphones, Wi-Fi, and Microsoft Office or Office 2016 for Mac with access to Office 365 cloud. Students must complete a one-semester work experience term (co-op or internship) after their second academic semester to graduate.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Postgraduate) B433 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
* George Brown College helps students identify work experience opportunities through a competitive interview process.
* Students are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experience.
* Work experience can be added to resumé after completion.
* George Brown College provides field education opportunities.
* Marketing students have access to membership in CMA and IAB associations as part of their tuition fees.
* CMA membership includes live and online events, professional development opportunities, resources, networking, and access to CMA NXT.
* IAB membership includes student volunteer opportunities, webinars, podcasts, research, digital ad standards, courses, certification, and custom workshops.
* Marketing Management – Digital Media program prepares graduates for careers in various roles such as Digital Marketing Assistant/Manager, Social Media Coordinator/Manager, Digital Content Manager, Media Planner, Digital Analyst, Community Manager, SEM Specialist, SEO Analyst, Account Coordinator/Manager.
* In-demand skills developed in the Marketing Management – Digital Media program include digital marketing, SEO, Google Analytics, and Microsoft 365.
* Graduates may obtain various marketing certifications including Hootsuite Social Marketing certification, Hootsuite Platform certification, and Google certifications.
* George Brown College aligns with industry demands in digital marketing skills.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Postgraduate) B433 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The B433 program requires a total of 13 mandatory courses and 1 work experience semester to graduate. The certifications mentioned are Hootsuite Social Marketing certification, Hootsuite Platform certification, Google Analytics certification, Google Ads certification, and Facebook Blueprint certification, which are not awarded by George Brown College.

The following is a list of courses in Semester 1 and their respective codes, course names, pre-requisites, and marks:

* CODE 1044 - Search Marketing, none
* CODE 2037 - Database Marketing Strategies, none
* CODE 4005 - Applied Business Communication, none
* CODE 4019 - Fundamentals of Marketing and IMC, none
* CODE 4022 - Content Marketing, none
* CODE 4023 - Paid Media Marketing, none
* CODE BUS 4000 - Work Experience Prep Course, none

The following is a list of courses in Semester 2 and their respective codes, course names, pre-requisites, and marks:

* CODE 1051 - Social Media Marketing, MARK 4022
* CODE 1054 - Strategic Marketing Project, successful completion of semester 1
* CODE 4020 - Owned Media Marketing, MARK 1044
* CODE 4019 - Analytics for Digital Marketing, MARK 4021
* CODE 4024 - Introduction to OMNI Channel Marketing, MARK 4019
* CODE 4019 - Digital Media Marketing Seminar Series, none

The work experience semester can be a co-op, internship, simulation, consulting, or research project. The graduate of the program will be able to formulate a marketing plan for a business or organization, develop an integrated marketing communications plan, formulate strategies for new and modified products, concepts, goods, and services, and develop strategies for the efficient and effective placement/distribution of products, concepts, goods, and services.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Postgraduate) B433 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text discusses various marketing-related functions and tasks, including evaluating marketing strategies' impact on finances and ROI, conducting market research, communicating marketing information, planning sales presentations, growing relationships, developing learning plans, applying entrepreneurial strategies, adhering to business ethics, employing management techniques, and recommending digital communication strategies. The text also provides information about tuition and fees for a college program, with domestic tuition being $4,492 for the first two semesters and international tuition being $18,428, as well as additional costs and a warning that fees are subject to change. The program includes one work experience semester but does not include the cost of this semester in the tuition fee. There is an additional fee of $500 for each work experience semester. (*)

(*) Note: It's essential to mention that this information is related to a college program and its marketing functions, not directly related to a specific product, concept, good, or service offered by the college.

Context: The text mentions that there is an additional fee of $500 for each work experience semester for students in a program at George Brown College. International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and can find more information on how to apply on the How to Apply page for international students. The text also states that some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions, and applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English proficiency test results must take the George Brown College English assessment. Applicants with relevant work experience may also be required to provide proof of English proficiency at the college level. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges and can contact the Admissions Office for inquiries about admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process. International students can contact a recruitment representative specialized by country of origin through the International Contact Us page or book a virtual meeting. Students can also attend on-campus information sessions to learn about program content, career options, and meet professors and staff. The text includes the email address for domestic student inquiries (admissions@georgebrown.ca).
